intro: Tripleurospermum sannineum, commonly known as the meadow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. The leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slight hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
